def_en: If you say that one person or thing is like another, you mean that they share some of the same qualities or features.
If you talk about what something or someone is like, you are talking about their qualities or features.
You can use like to introduce an example of the set of things or people that you have just mentioned.
You can use like to say that someone or something is in the same situation as another person or thing.

def_cn: （表示行为如同…一样）像孩子一样哭泣/像老鹰一样监视
def_en: If you say that someone is behaving like something or someone else, you mean that they are behaving in a way that is typical of that kind of thing or person. Like is used in this way in many fixed expressions, for example to cry like a baby and to watch someone like a hawk.

def_cn: （表示行为符合…的特点）她就是这么个人/这一点也不像他
def_en: You can use like in expressions such as that's just like her and it wasn't like him to indicate that the person's behaviour is or is not typical of their character.

def_cn: 好像，似乎（但事实并非如此）（一些人认为此用法不正确）
def_en: Like is sometimes used as a conjunction in order to say that something appears to be the case when it is not. Some people consider this use to be incorrect.

def_cn: 如同（一些人认为此用法不正确）
def_en: Like is sometimes used as a conjunction in order to indicate that something happens or is done in the same way as something else. Some people consider this use to be incorrect.

def_cn: （用于否定短语中强调以…为最）没有什么能比得上它/没有什么地方能比得上它
def_en: You can use like in negative expressions such as nothing like it and no place like it to emphasize that there is nothing as good as the situation, thing, or person mentioned.
You can use like in expressions such as nothing like to make an emphatic negative statement.

def_cn: （表示思考下面的话或用作口头禅）嗯，这个（一些人不喜欢此用法）
def_en: Some people say like when they are thinking about what to say next or because it has become their habit to say it. Some people do not like this use.

def_cn: （用于重述自己或他人当时的话或自己当时的想法）说，想（一些人不喜欢此用法）
def_en: Some people say like when they are reporting what they or another person said, or what they thought about something. Some people do not like this use.
If you like something or someone, you think they are interesting, enjoyable, or attractive.
If you ask someone how they like something, you are asking them for their opinion of it and whether they enjoy it or find it pleasant.
If you like something such as a particular course of action or way of behaving, you approve of it.
If you say that you like to do something or that you like something to be done, you mean that you prefer to do it or prefer it to be done as part of your normal life or routine.
If you say that you would like something or would like to do something, you are indicating a wish or desire that you have.
You can say that you would like to say something to indicate that you are about to say it.

def_cn: （礼貌地提议或邀请）想要
def_en: If you ask someone if they would like something or would like to do something, you are making a polite offer or invitation.

def_cn: （礼貌地请求或命令）希望
def_en: If you say to someone that you would like something or you would like them to do something, or ask them if they would like to do it, you are politely telling them what you want or what you want them to do.

def_cn: 同样（或相似）的人（或事物）
def_en: You can use like in expressions such as like attracts like, when you are referring to two or more people or things that have the same or similar characteristics.
Someone's likes are the things that they enjoy or find pleasant.
liking;
If you mention particular things or people and then add and the like, you are indicating that there are other similar things or people that can be included in what you are saying.

def_cn: （用于非正式地提出或同意建议）如果你乐意的话
def_en: You say if you like when you are making or agreeing to an offer or suggestion in a casual way.
You say if you like when you are expressing something in a different way, or in a way that you think some people might disagree with or find strange.
You can use the expressions like anything ,like crazy, or like mad to emphasize that someone is doing something or something is happening in a very energetic or noticeable way.
You can talk about the likes of someone or something to refer to people or things of a particular type.
If you say that something will happen like as not or as like as not, you mean that it will probably happen.
If you say that something will happen or is true like it or not, or whether someone likes it or not, you mean that although the situation may be unpleasant, it has to be faced.

def_cn: （用于展示过程）像这样/像那样/照这样
def_en: You say like this ,like that, or like so when you are showing someone how something is done.

def_cn: （用于吸引注意力）像这样/像那样
def_en: You use like this or like that when you are drawing attention to something that you are doing or that someone else is doing.

def_cn: （数量、名称、描述等）更接近于
def_en: You use the expression more like when mentioning an amount, name, or description that in your opinion is more accurate than one that has already been mentioned.
You use the expression something like with an amount, number, or description to indicate that it is approximately accurate.
If you say that's more like it, you mean that the thing that you are referring to is more satisfactory than it was on earlier occasions.

def_cn: 前所未有（或闻所未闻）的事物
def_en: If you refer to something the like of which or the likes of which has never been seen before, you are emphasizing how important, great, or noticeable the thing is.
